intro: Pedilanthus ierensis, commonly known as the Iberian pedilanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, evergreen leaves and showy, tubular flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
